articles.author: Sakura Murakami, Tim Kelly
articles.description: Calls to root out sexual harassment come as Japan faces rising threats from China, North Korea and Russia.
articles.title: Exclusive: Japan's military needs more women. But it's still failing on harassment.

articles.author: Dawoud Abu Alkas, Nidal Al-Mughrabi, Aidan Lewis, Saleh Salem
articles.description: Pupils sitting cross-legged on the sand take classes in a tent near Khan Younis in Gaza. Two sisters connect online to a West Bank school from Cairo. A professor in Germany helps Palestinian students link up with European universities.
articles.title: Gazans strive to study as war shatters education system

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Russian President Vladimir Putin has proposed a new defence minister, nominating civilian Andrei Belousov, a former deputy prime minister who specialises in economics, for the job more than two years into the Ukraine war, the Kremlin said on Sunday.
articles.title: Putin proposes a new civilian defence minister, wants incumbent in other role

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Flash floods and mud slides in Indonesia's West Sumatra province killed at least 37 people this weekend while the search for 17 missing people is still ongoing, authorities said on Monday.
articles.title: Floods kill 37 in Indonesia's West Sumatra, 17 missing

articles.author: Rishika Sadam, Jatindra Dash
articles.description: India voted on Monday in the fourth phase of a seven-week long general election, as campaign rhetoric became more strident over economic disparities and religious divisions.
articles.title: Indian election enters fourth phase as rhetoric over religion, inequality sharpens

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: A drone sparked a short-lived fire at an electrical substation in Russia's Lipetsk region in a Ukrainian attack that also targeted the Belgorod and Kursk regions, Russian officials said.
articles.title: Ukrainian drones attack at several Russian regions, officials say

articles.author: Nidal Al-Mughrabi
articles.description: Israel sent tanks into eastern Jabalia in the northern Gaza Strip early on Sunday, after a night of heavy aerial and ground bombardments, killing 19 people and wounding dozens of others, health officials said.
articles.title: Israel pushes back into northern Gaza, ups military pressure on Rafah

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: The Philippine Coast Guard (PCG) is committed to sustain a presence in a disputed area of the South China Sea to ensure China does not carrying our reclamation activities at the Sabina Shoal, its spokesperson said on Monday.
articles.title: Philippine coast guard won't allow China reclamation at disputed shoal, official says

articles.author: Tuvan Gumrukcu, Renee Maltezou
articles.description: Greek Prime Minister Kyriakos Mitsotakis will visit Turkey on Monday for talks with Turkish President Tayyip Erdogan aimed at maintaining the positive momentum achieved in bilateral ties in recent months despite lingering problems between the neighbours.
articles.title: Turkish and Greek leaders set for talks to maintain positive momentum

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: An Australian court on Monday rejected a bid by the country's cyber safety regulator to extend a temporary order for Elon Musk-owned X to block videos of the stabbing of an Assyrian church bishop, which authorities had called a terrorist attack.
articles.title: Australian court lifts order blocking X on church stabbing video
